name: benny
content:
benny noun [C]
(DRUG)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ usually plural ] a pill containing Benzedrine, which is a type of amphetamine (= a drug that makes the mind or body more active): Nearly every truck stop sold bennies under the counter.
More examplesFewer examplesOne of the results of the long hours that the drivers spend behind the wheel, almost all of them admit, is the use of methamphetamines or "bennies". As a former doper who has done bennies, I can state that their only virtue is making you wide awake and jumpy.Bennies were a type of speed commonly used by truckers back then because of the gruelling hauls.

benny noun [C]
(ANGER)
[ usually singular ] UK a sudden period of uncontrolled anger: He called her childish. So she had a bit of a benny. Synonym
tantrum
More examplesFewer examplesI hadn't had a benny for a few days actually.Stylist Hannah demands a beach's worth of sand be produced from the ether or she'll chuck a benny.We were told the chef had had "a benny" and had walked out!The guy behind me threw a benny and started honking.

benny noun [C]
(AT WORK)
[ usually plural ] US short for
benefit (= something that an employee receives in addition to his or her salary): If you lose that job, can you find another with the same level of salary and bennies?
More examplesFewer examplesThe trouble is, we just can't afford most blue collar unions anymore.
